course.subject: HUMA
course.name: Understanding Western Painting
course.description: This course introduces students to the masterpieces of Western Painting through an outline of chronology, painting techniques, life of the most renowned Western painters and painting genres by themes.

reviews.author: Selina
reviews.title: Just for painting lovers' course
reviews.comment_content: Teach you about detailed knowledge of western painting. The content includes the painters in different times, their works, their styles and it also requires you to identify and memorize ALL OF THEM, including the spelling. If you really like it, then just go for it; If you are not, then please don't hesitate to drop it!
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is very bad. The instructor's accent and tone are too strange for me to understand. I barely attended her course.
reviews.comment_grading: 0.5 points differentiate you with others by one sub-grade.
reviews.comment_workload: Just several quizzes, no homework. But really need your time and energy.

reviews.author: SSAC
reviews.comment_content:
These are the contents for this course:
Greek Vase Painting
Roman Wall Painting
Byzantine Art
Illuminated Manuscript
Gothic Art
Renaissance
Baroque
Rococo
English Painting
Neoclassicism
Romanticism
Pre-Raphael
French Realism
Impressionism
Modern Art

First few topics are relatively easy and there are not much things to memorize. But as you get to medieval and renaissance period, you will have to memorize different painters with names that I can hardly even pronounce and paintings that all look quite similar for me.
It gets relatively better at impressionism and modern art.

I took this course just to satisfy my common core requirement, and I regret taking this course without having any knowledge or information about western paintings.

I will recommend you to take this course only if you are truly interested in this area and know a lot about western paintings.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Anna is very passionate in her lectures.
She is also very kind and caring to students.
However, her way of teaching is slightly boring. Also,  you should go to all of her lectures or look at the lecture videos since you won't get a good grade by just looking at the ppt slides.
reviews.comment_grading:
Two quiz 30% each
One final

To be honest I didn't study a lot for the quizzes, but I think it would have been easy if you went to all lectures and memorized thoroughly.

I remember I just got mean for two quizzes and slightly above mean for final, and got B-.

This course was not appropriate for me, who knows nothing about western art and bad at memorizing people's name (Especially European names)
reviews.comment_workload:
No assignments or any projects.
But there are a lot of things to memorize

reviews.author: Carl ahn
reviews.comment_content: The content would be good if you love art so much however it is boring unless u are in love with art
reviews.comment_teaching: She is passionate about what she teach she teaches every lesson more than 1.20 hr
reviews.comment_workload: Honestly, you have to memorize everything every name pictures and each lecture slide is something lik 60 pages and each quizz you have to memorize 6,7 lecture notes before exam and exams are all short answers and a few MC and essays. So do not take this course if you are considering about your grade

reviews.author: LeaveSoon
reviews.title: Bad grading
reviews.comment_content:
Same as before
Do not expect to learn so much about the recent ones
reviews.comment_teaching:
Her pronunciation is very difficult to understand.
Its better to watch recorded videos than listening to real-time lecture
reviews.comment_grading:
Attendance (10%)
Mid Term (30%)
Final (60%)

You never know what kind of answer she is looking for. Including professional/correct term is a must but that does not secure you marks
reviews.comment_workload:
Reading materials do not help you much in preparing for the exam.
But they can give you more details / extra info which I think is more worth learning then the lecture itself

reviews.author: poon_siu
reviews.title: Good grade
reviews.comment_content: 2 midterms (30% each) and 1 final (40%). Questions are true/false, MC and short questions. The course is mainly about the style and technique used by painters from different periods, from ancient Greek to modern pop art. The course will test your understanding on different techniques and styles.
reviews.comment_teaching: Instructor is passionate in teaching Western paintings and encourages student to visit art museums. She is helpful and very willing to answer students questions. Teaching is good but there's still room for improvement.
reviews.comment_grading: Midterms and final are super easy if you study hard. I would say it's a good grade course.

reviews.author: Tuna
reviews.title: Good Grade CC
reviews.comment_content:
A brief picture of western painting. Though it sounds quite a long period of time but Anna only chose 15 period for introduction.
Greek Vase Painting
Roman Wall Painting
Byzantine Art
Illuminated Manuscript
Gothic Art
Renaissance
Baroque
Rococo
English Painting
Neoclassicism
Romanticism
Pre-Raphael
French Realism
Impressionism
Modern Art

Some period did go quite deep as it is long and famous. But some period Anna only use a few slides for introduction.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Anna is a good instructor. She's very nice and open to all questions. She did ask questions in the lectures to allow us to think more and analysis more.

She is also multilingual but the problem is her voice is a bit low so it's quite easy to sleep in class. But she did upload the lecture videos online so you can always do review whenever you get lost in her lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
Anna gave out 25% A range this semester (23 out of 91 people). That is really good grade compared to other courses.

The course included 2 quizzes and 1 final. (30% each for quiz and 40% for final)
There is additional 5% for a bonus question in the final.

The bonus question is quite easy that you only need to classify an unseen painting to a certain period and guess the painter when possible. If you study for the final, this should not be hard as the style are quite different.

Anna gave out a table to show all the scores, mean and sd for quizzes and finals. I get 1 sd above and turn out to have an A-.
reviews.comment_workload:
Assessments are all the workload.
Though there are readings every week, that's optional. I did read it but it is useless for the assessments. I only read it for more information.

There is also a voluntary museum visit. This semester she arranged two as Claude Monet is too famous that it really worth it. And she only arrange Monet's exhibition in the mid of semester. You don't necessarily need to go to the exhibition. But if you are interested, it really worth it.

reviews.author: vickie_135
reviews.title: For those with great memory
reviews.comment_content:
Don't take the course if you're not very interested in western painting / or you have bad memory (there are people who get 30/30 for each quiz, you can't compete with them). You get insights to some famous, some less famous artists, and about 3-8 of their paintings.
She uses a lot of jargon so you should keep the glossary she hands out because at first, most words are latin and french etc.
reviews.comment_teaching:
She goes into a lot of details. If you like art you'd find her interesting. If you don't, you'll probably end up falling asleep or focus on her groggy voice. She posts her lecture videos online so I really like that.
However, she made threatened us to go to the Monet art exhibition saying that there would be a question on it in the finals. There wasn't. (worth it but still.)
reviews.comment_grading: 1.6SD above mean and got an A. Was really hoping for an A+ but I really cannot compete with those who gets full marks on the quizzes. You need like a 28/30, i.e don't get more than 2 wrong.
reviews.comment_workload:
Compared to other courses, all you actually have to do is to memorize all your notes for 3 quizzes consisting of 30 MCQs. There are 15 topics in total and each quiz is tested on 5 topics. Does not sound like much but I decided to type my notes out and for each quiz my notes were 30 pages long - 9k words. Some say that I'm over-prepared but Anna quizzes on the most irrelevant questions you'd think that won't be tested on (e.g. where did the volcano in Rome erupt? why would you ask that...)
Don't even bother to read the assigned readings unless you really want to.

reviews.author: illiteracy
reviews.title: An informative course for those who don't want to be illiterate in western art
reviews.comment_content:
Basically every important type of painting, with examples, that appeared in the West from ancient Greek vase painting to Andy Warhol.  Extremely comprehensive and informative if you really are into western painting.  Gives you a detailed overview of western art with some background history.  Anna also explained painting styles and techniques with a considerable amount of jargons (no, the majority of them are not English words).  

I personally find the course not that challenging, but you'll need a good memory to score better than others in her quizzes.  Trust me, you'll always find someone who remembers everything and gets full scores, and some who choose not to remember a single word then get shitty scores.

The good news is, exams (or quizzes, the way she called them) are NOT accumulative.  In other words, 3000 years of western painting is divided (not equally) into 4 quizzes.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Anna is a great lecturer.  Multilingual and extremely knowledgeable.  She explains things clearly and analyzes paintings not only from the aesthetics, but also from socio-economic conditions, history, religions and politics.

But the main problem, as JC mentioned in HUMA2680's review, is her unidirectional way of teaching.  You'll need to take tons of notes and be very focused to get the most out of her lectures (and yes, she'll include all those small things you thought you won't be tested on in her quizzes).
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair.  

Final grading is based on all four quizzes (30% each for midterm and final quiz, 20% each for the rest two).  The quizzes include MCs,fill in the blanks and short essays (midterm and final quiz only).  There are around 20-25 questions per quiz, takes less than 45 minutes to finish a quiz.

My final score was around 1 to 1.2 s.d. above mean, got an A-
reviews.comment_workload:
A few pages of readings per week.  

To be honest I don't think they are included in the quizzes, but the readings will greatly help you understand the background of selected paintings.  Really worth the read.

The main source of workload comes from memorization of terms, paintings and painters.
